CatDescriptText: Miss Brenda Ware, 1110 Penn Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "I think that they should. Perhaps some people don't like to be married at an early age and want to wait a little longer."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Brenda Ware, wearing light colored shirt, coat, and shoulder strap of handbag over right shoulder, standing with right hand in pocket in front of marble wall between store windows, displaying heart shaped box and sign reading "Terheyden Co. Founded 1854"
